title: Authors and Citation
text: Roberts J, Schemilt (2026). costDeflateR: Convert costs times currencies. R package version 0.1.0.9000, https://github.com/jrob95/costDeflateR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {costDeflateR: Convert costs between times and currencies},   author = {Jack Roberts and Ian Schemilt},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/jrob95/costDeflateR}, }

what: Convert costs between times and currencies
title: Convert costs between times and currencies
text: costDeflateR R package designed help deflate currency values across countries years using GDP deflators PPP exchange rates IMF OECD datasets. provides tools adjusting monetary values common base, ensuring comparability across time geography.

title: Convert costs between times and currencies
code: # Install from GitHub (if using devtools or remotes) # remotes::install_github("jrob95/costDeflateR")

title: Convert costs between times and currencies
text: deflate(): Main function deflate currency values using GDP deflators PPP exchange rates. can use live IMF/ OECD data using use_live_data = TRUE delfator_country_year_combs(): Lists available country-year combinations reference datasets.

title: Convert costs between times and currencies
code: library(costDeflateR)  # Sample data data <- data.frame(   country_base = c("USA", "Germany"),   year_base = c(2010, 2015),   country_target = c("France", "Italy"),   year_target = c(2015, 2020),   cost_base = c(100, 200) )  # Deflate currency values deflated_data <- deflate(   input_data = data,   cost_base = "cost_base",   year_base = "year_base",   country_base = "country_base",   year_target = "year_target",   country_target = "country_target" )  print(deflated_data)

title: Convert costs between times and currencies
code: data <- data.frame(cost_base = c(100, 200))  deflated_data <- deflate(   input_data = data,   cost_base = "cost_base",   year_base = "2010",   country_base = "Australia",   year_target = "2020",   country_target = "United States",   rename_countries = TRUE )  print(deflated_data)

title: Convert costs between times and currencies
text: might know year/ country combinations data present PPPEX NGDP_D combination choice. delfator_country_year_combs() lets check.

title: Convert costs between times and currencies

title: Conditionally update internal data — cond_update_internal_data
text: Checks age dataset temporary directory updates missing older 7 days, `force` set TRUE.

title: Conditionally update internal data — cond_update_internal_data
code: cond_update_internal_data(   force = FALSE,   dl_oecdppp = TRUE,   dl_imfppp = TRUE,   dl_imfgdpd = TRUE )

title: Conditionally update internal data — cond_update_internal_data
text: force Logical. TRUE, forces update regardless data age. dl_oecdppp Logical. Whether check/update OECD PPP data. dl_imfppp Logical. Whether check/update IMF PPP data. dl_imfgdpd Logical. Whether check/update IMF GDP deflator data.

title: Conditionally update internal data — cond_update_internal_data
text: Path temporary data directory

Clean country names to match between IMF/ OECD ISO style country names and user input. — country_cleaner

title: Clean country names to match between IMF/ OECD ISO style country names and user input. — country_cleaner
text: helper function clean country names.

title: Country code list — country_code_list
text: `country_code_list` returns returns list available countries WEO data set.

title: Country code list — country_code_list
text: Returns tibble.

title: Country code list — country_code_list
text: helper function checking allowable country mappings `countrycode` package English iso3c standards.

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
text: `deflate()` returns dataframe deflated cost values, optionally adding five new columns depending input structure.

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
code: deflate(   input_data,   cost_base,   year_base,   country_base,   year_target,   country_target = "USA",   cost_target = "cost_target",   pppex_src = "IMF",   rename_countries = TRUE,   use_live_data = TRUE,   force_live_data = FALSE )

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
text: input_data `data.frame` containing data deflated. cost_base `character`: name column `input_data` containing base cost values. year_base `numeric` `character`: either year name column `input_data` containing base years. country_base `character` string: either country name name column `input_data` containing base countries. year_target `numeric` `character`: either year name column `input_data` containing target years. country_target `character`: either country name name column `input_data` containing target countries. cost_target `character`: name new column contain deflated cost values. Defaults `"cost_target"`. pppex_src `character`: source PPP data, either `"IMF"` `"OECD"`. rename_countries `logical`: whether standardize country names ISO3C format. Defaults `TRUE`. use_live_data `logical`: `TRUE`, updates internal data older one week. Defaults `TRUE`. force_live_data `logical`: `TRUE`, forces update internal data regardless age. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
text: `data.frame` original data additional column (named `cost_target`) containing deflated cost values.

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
text: function deflates currency values using GDP deflators PPP exchange rates. can either specify base target country/year row via column names, provide constant values apply across rows.

title: Deflate currency values — deflate
code: # Example 1: Using column names for base and target values data <- data.frame(   country_base = c("USA", "Germany"),   year_base = c(2010, 2015),   country_target = c("France", "Italy"),   year_target = c(2015, 2020),   cost_base = c(100, 200) )  # Deflate currency values deflated_data <- deflate(   input_data = data,   cost_base = "cost_base",   year_base = "year_base",   country_base = "country_base",   year_target = "year_target",   country_target = "country_target" ) #> Attempting to use live data from IMF/ OECD #> Updating IMF PPP data... #> [rsdmx][INFO] Fetching 'https://api.imf.org/external/sdmx/2.1/data/IMF.RES,WEO/*.PPPEX.*/all/'  #> Loaded live data: imf_ppp #> Updating IMF GDPD data... #> [rsdmx][INFO] Fetching 'https://api.imf.org/external/sdmx/2.1/data/IMF.RES,WEO/*.NGDP_D.*/all/'  #> Loaded live data: imf_gdpd  # You can also also specify values in the function for year and country data <- data.frame(   cost_base = c(100, 200) )  # Example 2: Using constant values for base and target deflated_data <- deflate(   input_data = data,   cost_base = "cost_base",   year_base = "2010",   country_base = "Australia",   year_target = "2020",   country_target = "United States",   rename_countries = TRUE ) #> Attempting to use live data from IMF/ OECD

title: IMF/ OECD data country/ year combo list — delfator_country_year_combs

title: IMF/ OECD data country/ year combo list — delfator_country_year_combs
text: pppex_src `character`, dataset PPP values come ? IMF OECD? use_live_data `logical`. Makes call `update_internal_data()`, current IMF OECD week old make API call replace ., default = `TRUE` force_live_data `logical`. Makes call `update_internal_data()` regardless age data currently stored. Use know IMF WEO OECD data updated since last ran
